website_summaries.verdict: A home swimming pool and spa water test kit that features numbered reagent bottles to make testing your water easier.
pros: This kit comes in a durable case and can test for chlorine, bromine, pH, acid demand, and total alkalinity
The color chips are UV protected and imbedded within the polyethylene test block to help ensure that the colors never fade
cons: Be sure to carefully follow the instructions for each test in order to achieve accurate results

customer_reviews.title: Color shade tip
customer_reviews.text: Works well when using the cheat sheet to get the drops right. I found that snapping a photo with your phone helps with the color determination. Seems to enhance them to where you can differentiate easier. Samsung S8.
customer_reviews.author: Mrkuppy

customer_reviews.title: As many others have said...chlorine test-kit is nearly worthless. Probably need to get my money back...what a waste.
customer_reviews.text: As other's have said, Chlorine is almost worthless. All you get is light yellow to dark yellow. The bests my eyes can tell, I"m between 2-4...maybe. That is a total "guestimate" and I'll have to have it checked at the pool store, which totally defeats the purpose. Honestly, cheap pool test-strips would have been a better investment. Poolmaster has to circle back and figure out why their chlorine test kit has such a high failure rate. It's totally unacceptable. If the pool store comes up with a very different number, I'm filing a dispute to get my money back. If somewhat close, I'll give it a second star.
customer_reviews.author: E_Dogg

customer_reviews.title: The Clorox pool test strips were tried, but in the end, I just couldn't get consistent results.
customer_reviews.text: Since the test strips didn't work out for us, we tried this 5-way kit and finally I'm getting consistent results! If you can read instructions and then follow them, you will like this kit. At first I thought it may be for a professional, but that's not the case. Just start on pg 1 and do the first test it tells you and simply follow the clearly written instructions. If your a novice to pool testing, don't be intimidated by this test kit, it works.
customer_reviews.author: Jones

customer_reviews.title: Great beginner kit
customer_reviews.text: Really, really love this pool test kit. Recently purchased a 16'x48" pool and have been using this test kit almost daily to test and maintain my water. The kit is easy to use and the instructions provided are very clear. The results, compared against that of my local pool stores analysis, have been very similar. Yes, there are better, more expensive kits out there. But if you are just starting out or wanting to know more about your pool water chemistry then this is a great, inexpensive kit.
customer_reviews.author: Buck Chuck

customer_reviews.title: A must have
customer_reviews.text: This is a good set but I have one complaint the bottles are bigger then my basic ph/ chlorine test set but the drops are also bigger which means when I'm doing these basic tests it goes just as fast as the smaller test kit. With that being said the kit is great for keeping your pool clear in the summer..a must have and I will buy again. It has vary easy to read and follow instructions and a nice box to keep everything organized
customer_reviews.author: MIKEJANINA

customer_reviews.title: Easy and effective
customer_reviews.text: This test is very simple to use and much easier to read than test strips. Do read the instruction booklet twice before using. If you do not have experience with a similar kit, I find the abbreviated instruction card to be a little confusing. It is a bit of a trick to measure the free chlorine as you have to compare the results instantly but you get the hang of it. I have been a pool owner for four months. I was losing my mind for the first couple of months trying to read test strips and consistently misdiagnosing my pool's chemical balance. Only after purchasing this kit do I feel I really have a handle on things.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My Pool Water Is Perfect!!!
customer_reviews.text: I recently bought a 10×30 Intex above ground pool for me and my kids to enjoy while we are quarantined at home. My husband only agreed to the purchaee, if I handled the upkeep of it, including the pool water. I had a chlorine skimmer going, but the pool water started looking murky. After reading the great reviews, I purchased this kit and it told me right away, what my PH level and chlorine levels were. I felt like I was in Chemistry class! Lol It was easy to mix the chemicals and you can't beat the price. The kit should last through the summer. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie

customer_reviews.title: Not the model with the slot behind for the white paper.
customer_reviews.text: This model doesn't include the slot behind to put the white background so you can see the colors easier. I had to hold the white paper behind it to see the colors correctly. Guess I should have spent a little more for the other model that comes with the slot, but besides that, seems to work perfect so far! Just follow the included directions and you should be fine.
customer_reviews.author: Niceguy

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny...
customer_reviews.text: New homeowner and I’m doing my best to figure out pool maintenance without breaking the bank. This is a very basic, user friendly way to measure the chemical composition of your pool. Within an hour of opening the box I was able to measure the chlorine content of the pool, the PH level, and alkalinity. Within a few days, my pool water was clear and we jumped in for the first time - granted I backwashed the pump, cleaned the filter, brushed the pool, and vacuumed the pool floor - this is work people, but totally worth it. Will buy again.
customer_reviews.author: RemyNYC

customer_reviews.title: Wow!
customer_reviews.text: I am extremely pleased with the Poolmaster Essential Collection Chemistry Case (22260) 5-Way Swimming Pool & Spa Water Test Kit. Our ever reliable pool store closed, so I have been on my own for testing our pool water. I am very pleased with the simplicity and accuracy of this kit. I don’t get a printed readout with specific readings, but the color coded results appear to be on target and I have been able to balance and maintain crystal clear water. If I had started with this when I first got my pool 8 years ago, I would have save countless trips to the store, never mind how much money I dropped on supplies I may not have needed!
customer_reviews.author: Phil O. Mont

customer_reviews.title: Chemicals in this kit were old
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this kit for our pool because our old kit didn’t have a chlorine test port that would read over 3 and this one reads to 5. We started to use this kit and our chemicals in our pool never were right. So we finally took the kit and our water to the pool place and we discovered that the chemicals in this kit were old. Do not purchase this kit. The chemicals are old and you will never get a good reading on your pool.
customer_reviews.author: Lennie Browning

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I am using this for a Spa and the only down side is I had to scale down the acid demand chart to my Spa size which is about 500 gal. For me one drop of acid demand chemical equates to requiring 1Tbs of "pH reducer" a.k.a. acid. As far as using a color chart to determine the results, it's not always easy to tell where your results land on the scale. Naturally holding it up against a white background helps a lot. Overall this is a great tool and I am glad I purchased it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Never matched the pool store results
customer_reviews.text: I don’t understand. We have high alkalinity in our area so it takes a lot of time to bring that level down. Every time I tested alkalinity it always was up over 200-300 ppm. Took it in to pool sore for readings and it slowly dropped the alkalinity down as we added in our ph decrease. Now once did this all test show reduction. The chlorine test is worthless if you want actual free, total , and combined chlorine. pH is about the only accurate measurement we ever got
customer_reviews.author: Sassy

customer_reviews.title: Bottles of colored water not true chemicals
customer_reviews.text: Let me begin by saying I have a degree in chemistry, however it doesn’t take a science degree to recognize products that don’t work. I used this product to test four different pools; new and existing installs. The colors never changed. They all became washed out versions of whatever mixture was in the individual bottle. Speaking of bottles, my kit looked as if it had been used, replaced with water and retuned. I had to purchase another pool testing kit which yielded excellent results. I do not and would not recommend this kit.
customer_reviews.author: MrsShaunshoppingdiva

customer_reviews.title: This is so easy, save a buck know what’s actually going on with your pool.
customer_reviews.text: If you’re not colorblind, or don’t mind paying the pool guy 45.00 for a 10 minute service, buy one of these kits. Honestly, after maintaining our pool for a few times, it’s soo easy. In my case, we leave our home, and need someone while we’re out, but nothing after that! Last year, our pool guy who said he had 10 years experience tried fixing a leaking pipe with string and a piece of rubber, did I say former pool guy!
customer_reviews.author: Skipper

customer_reviews.title: Good Testing Kit, Not So Good Container
customer_reviews.text: This is very easy to use. It seems accurate and it fairly easy to use. My only complaint is the durability of the case. The first day we received it, I used it to test the chemicals in our spa. I put it on the table in our backyard and it fell off the table onto the grass. The latch to close the kit broke right off and now the box won’t close and is left wide open all the time. I will need to get a rubber band or something to keep it closed....
customer_reviews.author: NEL

customer_reviews.title: terrible
customer_reviews.text: I suspect there is some variability in quality. I have been using OTO test kits for 20+ years. The one I received had the chlorine middle 3 color match indicators the same color. It is not that I just can't tell a difference in yellow hues. I even checked with other family/friends and none of them could see a color difference either. This means the test kit is useless since I cannot differentiate within the most important range.
customer_reviews.author: Lance_big_daddy

customer_reviews.title: Great kit with ample instructions
customer_reviews.text: Really glad I purchased this pool test kit. Everything came in good condition. My only concern is that the solution bottles seemed like a bit under-filled.
customer_reviews.author: Van R

customer_reviews.title: Did not have bromine levels marked
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to measure the bromine levels in our spa. It said it could, the directions say that it should, but alas it does not. It is like they forgot to put the sticker to indicate the bromine levels on the vial. Maybe the one I received was defective??
customer_reviews.author: KH

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed! Doesn’t work! Don’t buy!
customer_reviews.text: Doesn’t work!! Don’t buy! I don’t understand the highly rated positive reviews. Alkalinity test ... you will stand there forever as it doesn’t change from violet to yellow/clear. Chlorine is always the same yellow. I used my old test kit ... where results are very satisfying and you know exactly where the pool readings are. Very disappointed! I wish I could get my money back or at least a new set of chemicals ... am I missing something here because the reviews are very high ... where I’m being 100% honest that this test kit is poor quality!
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: Very difficult to determine test results
customer_reviews.text: I have used a test kit from this company for a very long time. This new kit, with the large vial for PH/Alkalinity, etc has probably four times the water volume of the old test kit. As a result, the colors in the vial are so pale in comparison to the color scale that it is extremely difficult to read the results. To top it off, it is not returnable, supposedly due to shipping restrictions on the chemicals. I would not buy this product.
customer_reviews.author: wdr

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Besides working well, what I like most is that the labels on the bottles are plastic or some other non-absorbing material. So wet hands or other splashed water doesn’t leave the kit looking like a raggedy mess.
customer_reviews.author: Tampabuc

customer_reviews.title: Sometimes you win, sometimes you lose.
customer_reviews.text: With most products you get mixed reviews. You gamble that your experience is a 5 rather than a one. In this unfortunate case we busted on our gamble. Virtually impossible to differentiate colors. We looked in all forms of lighting. It also seems the alkalinity test doesn’t work at all. Like other reviews, regardless of how many drops we added the color never change. I believe we cannot get refund so I came up craps this time.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: A great, easy-to-use and understand, Use-it-every-day test kit.
customer_reviews.text: Though there are other high-falutin test kits out there that take themselves way to seriously, and are important to know about, they come with a steep price, complicated instructions and learning curve. For quick and easy everyday testing, this kit is fantastic - especially for a vinyl liner pool.
customer_reviews.author: S. Levy

customer_reviews.title: Accuracy is more important than speed.
customer_reviews.text: This test kit provided the best outcome for adjusting my spa water yet. Takes a bit more time but it is worth it. My water not looks like fresh tap water. It tests that way now too. Have a more accurate reading and directions on making the correct adjustments is excellent. I have used test strips for years. I was never really happy with them because I just could not keep my hot tub water clear and pleasant. I am never going back to strips.
customer_reviews.author: TBFY2

customer_reviews.title: Great product for a beginner.
customer_reviews.text: I'm new to pool, and still learning pool maintenance, so I bought this product because of its good rating. It's easy to use, the instruction is clear, and I think it could last one season without problem. I kept tracking the pool pH everyday for a two week period, and found out no change at all, then I tried lemon juice, it did change, so I thought the kit worked, it's just the pool pH changed a little, and now I only test pH occasionally. But I do test Chlorine often, and pour SHOCK into our pool according to the result. Other solutions I don't use that often.
customer_reviews.author: Harry

customer_reviews.title: Unreadable chlorine test.
customer_reviews.text: Now reading more reviews I'm not sure how this tests gets good reviews as the chlorine test, the primary reason to use it requires you to compare your sample to a yellow scale with TINY variations on shading and which are all less vivd than the solution you'll be comparing them too. Test strips are the way to go.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Great Accuracy, Pool Maintenance Must Buy
customer_reviews.text: World's of difference in telling you what your pool's chemical balance is compared to strips. Very accurate & made it easy for me to know what chemicals to add & how much. Maintaining the pool is easy now. Comes with instruction booklet. Highly recommended. Provides sufficient testing chemicals to last many years.
customer_reviews.author: Vic

customer_reviews.title: Chlorine is wrong !
customer_reviews.text: The chlorine test did not change color at all . It said 2.0 no matter what the actual . Even when it got to 7 . Garbage. I used 10 strips And went to the pool shop to confirm.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work and can't return
customer_reviews.text: Didn't know it was not eligible for returns, probably should have made it more obvious. I wouldn't be concerned with not being able to return the product if it actually worked. We had to use so many drops to make the water sample turn even a slight color. And no it wasn't because of our water because a similar water test kit gives us no issues at all with testing the water. This test kit produces completely inaccurate results.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Pool Spa Test kit for the money
customer_reviews.text: This is a great pool spa water test kit for the price. It would be nice if it contained a test for water hardness. I had to buy the Hardness test strips to get that reading. The more expensive Taylor kit has the hardness test but at much higher cost. Also the refill chemical pack is almost the same price as this kit. If they could sell large bottles of the replacement chemicals for this kit that would be great. I will have to look around the internet for those.
customer_reviews.author: Basil F Yousif

customer_reviews.title: Better than Test Strips
customer_reviews.text: PH and Alkalinity tests match the plastic color strips and were consistent with the Pool Store tests numbers. However the Chlorine plastic color strips are a different tone of yellow, than the treated bright yellow water color in the tube, as a result the tested water color appears to be off the charts, that is 5+. The Pool Store test was 2.5. Also the using a test strip, it looks to be a 2. The test strips I'd been using are not very useful for precise PH and Alkalinity readings.
customer_reviews.author: SteveS

customer_reviews.title: Terrible kit!!
customer_reviews.text: This kit is terrible, I just used it for the 1st time and it's past it's return date. Bottles were already open, the plastic clip on the box was broken and it's giving me inaccurate readings. Save your money, get another kit, this one is awful!!
customer_reviews.author: frankO

customer_reviews.title: Works as good as the one at the pool store!!
customer_reviews.text: I use the Aqua check strips which work great! I bought the Poolmaster this year because it tests a lot more and for the price I paid($15), it works great and I will continue to use it! I don’t have to run to the pool store anymore because the tests are the same. I still like to use the strips for a quick test.
customer_reviews.author: C.T.

customer_reviews.title: Great test kit! A must-have for your pool!
customer_reviews.text: This is a very easy to use test kit.Don't let the appearance make you think it's hard or you need to be a chemist to use it! I mainly use the chlorine and Ph tests. Very simple to use, pretty clear instructions (use the quick reference card instead of the booklet, easier to understand). Quick results. Seems accurate. This is a definite must-have tool if you have a pool.
customer_reviews.author: dragonfly2girls

customer_reviews.title: Professional qauality
customer_reviews.text: The new Pool Guy was impressed when he discovered I have a set just like his, and even know how to use it! :-D Doing battle with a pool "issue" in 112-degree heat -- this gives us both a tool that measures chemistry exactly the same. When he's not here, I can test the pool two or three times a day and report results that make real sense for him. And...the issue is now almost under control!
customer_reviews.author: Victoria H.Top Contributor: Fountain Pens

customer_reviews.title: Seller quality control issues
customer_reviews.text: Four of five bottles where not safety sealed, which is an indicator of the seller’s quality control issues.
customer_reviews.author: DAVID3801

customer_reviews.title: Multi test easy directions on how much and of what needs adding
customer_reviews.text: After getting the free water test yeah right cost me a minimum 80.00 every time for free water test and always something off needing there chemicals not anymore since I bought this kit. Love it save 100’s already
customer_reviews.author: Carperson

customer_reviews.title: Instructions could be clearer, but otherwise it's a fantastic value.
customer_reviews.text: Much better accuracy than the strips, and better quality than the HTH brand at Wal-Mart. Love the little handy dandy case. Instructions need to be clearer for ditsy blondes such as myself. If I wasn't slightly pool savvy, I'd be lost.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Adkins

customer_reviews.title: Not properly capped and leaked
customer_reviews.text: Opened this morning and the alkininity bottle cap was not on tight and leaked. The irony is the additional notice enclosed. If the cap was on properly likely not to happen. All the bottles were jostled in shipping. Sealed caps are a smart move. When I went to properly seat the cap it leaked all over my hand
customer_reviews.author: TV

customer_reviews.title: inaccurate
customer_reviews.text: The box everything comes in is handy. I also like testing tube. Easy to read. The chlorine and pH reading are pretty accurate, however the alkalinity is way off. I know this because it reads extremely high (over 200) but when compared with two other home tests and my pool supplier which confirmed the other test kits, I knew the alkalinity test with this kit was wrong. Perhaps its just old, but I just purchased it.
customer_reviews.author: ainsleysmom

customer_reviews.title: Inaccurate tests results
customer_reviews.text: Tested at first, shows that my chlorine level is very low, so I added more chlorine. After I added 1 gallon of Chlorine to 20.000 gallon pool, my chlorine level went over the roof. I couldn't understand why, until I tested again. Zero chlorine shows again even after 2-3 test samples. Took it to pool store, chlorine is around 6ppm. Goes back.
customer_reviews.author: Batya

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: I needed something a bit better than test strips and bought this test kit based on price an reviews. Price is excellent - I couldn't find anything cheaper. Ease of use is somewhat challenging - specifically for the Chlorine test. It's difficult to tell exactly how much or little Chlorine is present because the colors are faint and similar looking. Somebody here had suggested taking a picture of your results with the camera phone to better compare the colors. It's not a $100 test kit, but works as good a sub $20 test kit can.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive and Accurate.
customer_reviews.text: I love these 5 Ways to test your water kits. Very Accurate and Instructions included. once u use them a few times it takes about 5 mins to test the complete water quality.
customer_reviews.author: Daisy

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic product
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use helps me know my pool is safe would recommend
customer_reviews.author: Mags coulter

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work
customer_reviews.text: One of the many things I bought during a pump conversion for my pool. Everything works great now. I found that this kit didn't work at all. After following all directions exactly, I got no results or really skewed results. So, I took a water sample to the local pool store and had it tested. There I got accurate results.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Edge

customer_reviews.title: Quality Pool Test Kit
customer_reviews.text: This is s fine five way pool test kit. I like this kit because reference colors match what the chemicals say the status of the water is. My previous kit reference colors never matched. The labels on the bottles are plastic. The previous kit labels were paper and washed away over time. I'm happy.
customer_reviews.author: MarkMWS

customer_reviews.title: Test is very easy to use too
customer_reviews.text: Took me years to buy one of these, have been using the strips this entire time. Our pool became cloudy last month, and while the strips were saying everything was on par, I couldnt figure out the cloudiness. I purchased the kit, and after a thorough runthrough of tests, the kit told me what was off. Added needed chemicals to balance out the base, and one week later the pool was perfectly clear. Test is very easy to use too, can't believe I was afraid to use one. I do continue to use the strips, but test with this once a week. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Millet

customer_reviews.title: Careful. This product is defective and can not be returned
customer_reviews.text: First of all the box was black and not blue. More importantly the acid demand chemical arrived opened and does not react to give an accurate reading. When attempting a return was told ineligible for returns. Will find a different product.
customer_reviews.author: Project Firestart

customer_reviews.title: 4/5 but a decent product
customer_reviews.text: At first I thought this kit did not work. No matter what I did, the colors did not change in my test samples. Little did I know, the pool water in the house we bought was so acidic that we needed several large bags of baking soda and pot ash just to get to the low end of the test. I'm giving the kit a 4 because the writing on the bottles is not water proof. One bottle got slightly wet and the printing smeared off.
customer_reviews.author: Master

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: I should have read the reviews before ordering. Like the others giving one star, I got no change in color analyzing alkalinity or ph. The only useful test showed I was over chlorinated. I threw the kit in the trash and will pay a pool tech to come once a week or month to check my pond.
customer_reviews.author: William Dobbins

customer_reviews.title: The Gold Standard
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly the right test kit for the homeowner. I used to try to get two or three years out of a kit, but it's just not worth the stretch. Better to have the right thing in brand-new condition at the right time. In a matter of a minute or two you can keep your pool chemistry just right.
customer_reviews.author: Ray Paseur

customer_reviews.title: The colors are hard to decipher in my opinion
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to try to get better accuracy than the dip sticks that we normally use. This kit is definitely more complicated but comes with a colorful quick tips manual. I am not sure of the accuracy though. I thought we were good according to the kit, but when we took up the pool store, we were way off
customer_reviews.author: jb adams

customer_reviews.title: Easy and accurate
customer_reviews.text: Took me a total of two minutes of reading through the guide. Easy to get samples and take readings. However, bottle #3 will not last long. This is the drops to find Total Alkalinity. One test and the bottle is 1/3 used. But this test is not a daily test. I am very pleased with the chlorine and ph testing. When I use my clorox strips, they show 0 chlorine but this kit showed 2 ppm on one day. And the next my level dropped to 1 ppm which is expected in the Az heat.
customer_reviews.author: R.Shoup

customer_reviews.title: No Support!
customer_reviews.text: Received my kit, took it out to the pool, proceeded to use it. My results were unlike anything I saw in their literature. Called the company, Poolmaster for advise and was told they have no technical people to answer my question(s). What? I got a refund for defective product. I'm staying away from Poolmaster!
customer_reviews.author: RF

customer_reviews.title: Open and incomplete kit.
customer_reviews.text: Container was broken and the pieces were out in the shipping box. Four of the five solution bottles were tampered with and seal broken, with half or some of the solution used. In this 5-Way test kit there was only four of the five solutions. There were two of the #5 solution and no #4 solution, which most of the test that this kit can be used for requires the #4 solution. Kit is pretty much worthless to use.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Smith

customer_reviews.title: It comes with clear directions and a nice carrying case
customer_reviews.text: Products as described. It comes with clear directions and a nice carrying case. This is a lot more accurate than those testing strips. This kit tells your pH levels, acidity levels, alkaline levels, etc. It helps you determine how much acid or base you need to add. I would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Peter H.

customer_reviews.title: Lid doesn't latch properly
customer_reviews.text: Second time I purchased this product. The lid on the large tube doesn’t fit properly, so I used the old one. Then the lid won’t lock securely to the container. Very irritating when picking the contain up, lid opens and the contents drop to the ground. I would use the old container too, but I had already discarded it.
customer_reviews.author: OcotilloFats

customer_reviews.title: Good kit
customer_reviews.text: so I have used this all year and I would say I'm satisfied. I have on several occasions when I have time used this test kit and also take water samples to 3 different pool stores to cross check. None are the same on all the tests but close enough when I today this kit the most.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: get a better test kit
customer_reviews.text: If you care about pool chemistry, get a better test kit. If you are only passively checking things out, or maybe only opening your pool for a month or two, this will be sufficient.
customer_reviews.author: Cam

customer_reviews.title: Non refundable
customer_reviews.text: I bought this thinking I was getting a pool. It didn’t work out so I wanted to return it (unopened) and was told it’s not returnable? Not happy about that at all.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly

customer_reviews.title: Great kit at a great price
customer_reviews.text: Have found this kit very easy to use with results very close to the electronic generated sheet at the pool store. Much easier to match colors with drops than using strips. Strips have never worked for my eyes. Highly recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: Fergdaddy

customer_reviews.title: Kit arrived with a defective cap :(
customer_reviews.text: When my kit arrived the red cap was damaged and does not fit the top of the test tube. So I am unable to even use the kit. I when you return/exchange the kit but because this kit has flammable chemicals it is not returnable. All I want is a kit that works and to get what I paid for...can the seller please send me a new red cap or exchange the kit?
customer_reviews.author: Troy Mortensen

customer_reviews.title: Very helpful
customer_reviews.text: Instructions are somewhat lacking direction regarding balancing. The kit comes fully stocked but you will find that you balance the chlorine levels more than anything else and I wish there was more of that solution than anything else.
customer_reviews.author: The Nelsons

customer_reviews.title: Bad product
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this. You can’t read the differences in yellow on the first test and then in another test you are supposed to add drops until water changes color but it never changes. Also you can’t return this item. I don’t know how it got good reviews
customer_reviews.author: steveo

customer_reviews.title: replace the test color tube
customer_reviews.text: We have used your product over the last several years. But, this order is horrible, being the chlorine side of the test tube is almost all one color, so you can't tell where your chlorine level is. Please replace the tube, so we can test our pool water accurately, as before. WE know the return is over, but we had more of the older kit and didn't start using this kit till a week ago. Thx
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: Test Easy to read
customer_reviews.text: We have a special pool filter in our pool so we do not have to do a lot with the chemicals in the pool. In that regard the only two tests we do with the pool test kit is pH and total alkalinity. These two tests are clear to read and understand what levels that you're at. As some pointed out the directions are a little confusing at first.... but after you re-read the card and the booklet that comes with the kit the directions are understandable. I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria

customer_reviews.title: be aware
customer_reviews.text: Leaving the chlorine test in the tube for even a few minutes when your level is high can permanently stain! tried both vinegar and bleach to remove and failed!
customer_reviews.author: Lw

customer_reviews.title: Not accurate!
customer_reviews.text: Not accurate! This test vs test strips vs paying for testing from a pool company (digital machine) and the result was the company test matched the strips but not this test! Compared results twice, two different days.
customer_reviews.author: shickie

customer_reviews.title: The #3 solution (Acid Demand) does not work
customer_reviews.text: I was unable to complete an acid demand or alkalinity ppm test with the #3 solution. no matter how many drops of solution I used I could not initiate a change in the test sample. I had some solution from my old kit which I replaced with this product and was able to obtain a reading with only a few drops. There was no option to return or request a replacement for the defective component. It appears I would have to replace the #3 solution at near the cost of the entire kit. Its as though the bottle contains only water? The PH and chlorine components appear to work ok.
customer_reviews.author: cpearson

customer_reviews.title: The chems provide accurate readings and the documentation is straightforward and easy to understand
customer_reviews.text: I really hate to give five star ratings but this product earned them. Checked my results against pool business testing and were right on. Best thing though is something rarely found in today's products, the documentation. Clear instructions and easy steps.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Easy to get accurate reading
customer_reviews.text: Had been using test strips for our new hot tub, but was frustrated that I could never really determine the pH. This test kit is great, I feel like a chemist! Now I don't have to worry about making mistakes. The only thing it doesn't include is calcium, so I'll need the test strips to check that when I first fill the hot tub.
customer_reviews.author: Savvy Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Good Sampling Kit
customer_reviews.text: The instructions are straightforward. This kit works just fine for all parameters included. The chlorine yellow-orange(ish) scale doesn't reconcile perfectly with the color gradient the reagent will actually tint the water samples, it's close enough to get a good idea of where the the chlorine level is at though (within ~0.5 ppm anyway).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So much more accurate than the strips
customer_reviews.text: We love the ease with which this chemestry case is used. Since getting it the chemicals in our pool have been completely accurate, making it lovely to look at and a pleasure to swim in. We used those strips before and this worth the extra money.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Good price and instrumental in improving my hot tub water chemistry
customer_reviews.text: I use this product on my hot tub and the precision of the measurements was critical to getting my water chemistry under control. I used to use water test strips but the color implied ranges caused me to chase my ph and alkaline levels up and down. This product allows me to be more precise and my water quality has been great and consistent ever since.
customer_reviews.author: Ian O.

customer_reviews.title: Faulty #3 test drops
customer_reviews.text: The #3 bottle did not work - faulty bottle. It did not have plastic seal on it like the other bottles had. Kept adding the drops on my alkalinity test and got to 20 + drops with no color change. Brought sample to pool store and alkalinity in perfect range. Of course waited to use the kit until past the one month return time (still had a bit left in my previous kit). Would appreciate it if pool master sent me at least a replacement for the #3 bottle, other bottles seem to be fine.
customer_reviews.author: Wes A.

customer_reviews.title: No what I was expecting
customer_reviews.text: The case arrived cracked and broken. The items inside were fine. The PH and Chlorine test is okay, not very easy to fill both vials at the same time and get the correct level of water. The Alkalinity test is very unclear as the drops turn the water blue, but its very light blue and the instructions say the water may turn clear or red when testing. It is not easy to read. I would suggest trying a different brand to get accurate readings.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The product arrived with the blue box crushed to peices
customer_reviews.text: I have no holder for the kid it's literally in 100's of pieces.
customer_reviews.author: Pat Brown

customer_reviews.title: Great Accuracy
customer_reviews.text: Great product....especially for the price. I follow the testing up occasionally with my pool supplier and it's always right on. I would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, but questionable Chlorine accuracy
customer_reviews.text: This is a good little kit for the money. It's nice and organized inside the box, and comes with good detailed instructions. My only complaint is that I am not overly confident in the Chlorine content accuracy, which is a big issue for my pool since it tends to burn through sanitizer like crazy during the summer. I wish the gradient levels of yellow were a bit more distinguishable in order to really hone in on the Chlorine level.
customer_reviews.author: Ian L.

customer_reviews.title: Product chemical quality is not consistent. I've purchased last ...
customer_reviews.text: Product chemical quality is not consistent. I've purchased last year and measurements were correct, this year I purchased new one and all (Ph and chlorine) measurements are always 1 level off
customer_reviews.author: Mrbtl

customer_reviews.title: The alkalinity test is way off.
customer_reviews.text: The alkalinity in my Taylor test set and at the pool store is 100 in my pool, and 130 with this test kit. This is a difference of adding over almost 2 gallons of muratic acid to bring it down to 100 or it being perfect at 100. This difference will ruin pool equipment and the pool! it is worth paying the difference for a better kit. Unfortunately, it is just outside the 30 day window to return the kit, so I am out the $16. It will be responsibly disposed in chemical waste.
customer_reviews.author: L. Sayer

customer_reviews.title: Color coding is impossible to read.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this kit based on the great star rating on here, but I have no idea why it gets such great reviews. The color coding makes it impossible to read, especially the Chlorine side. The yellows are so close together, specifically 1.0 and .6 which are the most important. I’m a designer and have been dealing with colors for over 25 years and I can tell small differences in color variations and with this kit it’s impossible. I can’t imagine how everyone else is getting accurate results. You all must be guessing which color is the right one.
customer_reviews.author: Antonio

customer_reviews.title: I am very happy with the results.
customer_reviews.text: Just great, and very easy to use. Much more accurate than strips The Meter is very easy to ready. I fill the chlorine-bromine tester and one drop of solution gives me accurate levels. The PH tester is also very easy to read, and after I get the level with another drop solution. I add an additional solution and count the drops in order to find out how much muriatic acid I need to add in order to correct balance. No more over chlorinating with poor results due to high PH. When I run out of solution. I will try the Poolmaster 7 way tester. All in All, as a novice I am very happy with the results.
customer_reviews.author: R. READ

customer_reviews.title: Reagent #3 is useless!
customer_reviews.text: This is the 2nd kit I bought, and reagent number 3 does not work! There is no return. Buyer beware!
customer_reviews.author: J Blaze

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: We were somewhat confused but we are brand new pool owners. Purchased 2 kits, they came immediately. We realized it was just easier taking samples to Leslie’s Pool Supply weekly for free. We did use this when we had a bunch of kids in the pool and the water looked very cloudy, fixed that problem thanks to this sample kit.
customer_reviews.author: Halley

customer_reviews.title: Super item
customer_reviews.text: Great pool Product has everything you need to test your pool plus charts
customer_reviews.author: Janice

customer_reviews.title: More complicated than I wanted
customer_reviews.text: You tend to use some of the chemicals more than others and need to replace them. I found that using premixed chlorine and PH testing solutions are far simpler and generally meets your common home pool needs.
customer_reviews.author: CaptainPico

customer_reviews.title: A quality test kit
customer_reviews.text: We use this test kit with our Intex pool and have had excellent results. The testing instructions are easy to understand and take the guess work out of insuring our pool water is clear & safe to swim in. We've used this kit for one Summer season thus far, and foresee it lasting another season before needing to resupply any of the test chemicals. You can't go wrong purchasing & using this kit (in my opinion& experience).
customer_reviews.author: Rob T.

customer_reviews.title: Beware of Faulty Regeants
customer_reviews.text: One of my regeants (#3) wasn’t affecting the PH in the pool water testing tube. After trying multiple times, I just gave up and borrowed a neighbors kit which worked fine. I may have received a bad or old set of test chemicals. Either way, you may want to steer clear.
customer_reviews.author: VJ Costanzo

customer_reviews.title: Not sure chlorine is accurate
customer_reviews.text: At first i thought the chlorine test was not accurate since it was registering as 2 and always yellow, but my pool was technically 5 by the pool place test and my dip strip test. I took this to test my dads pool which i knew the chlorine was high and on his pool test it went to the 5 and orange color.
customer_reviews.author: lzstll

customer_reviews.title: Perfect testing product
customer_reviews.text: This is the most simple pool testing kit. Everything is there and the directions are great. Even gives you the tables for reference of how much acid to add. We have a saltwater pool. I usually take a sample in to the pool store twice a year to test for salt and stabilizer. But, for acid, chlorine and alkalinity this is my favorite kit. I have tried others.
customer_reviews.author: r west

customer_reviews.title: YOU WONT FIND A BETTER UNIT FOR A CHEAPER PRICE!
customer_reviews.text: You honestly won't find a better unit for a cheaper price....seriously I've looked. I'm super cheap and I spent hours to make sure that I was getting a pool reader with all the features, but also for dirt cheap. And guess what? This is the unit I bought. Save yourself the time and energy and hit the buy it now already.
customer_reviews.author: TheFurnitureGuy

customer_reviews.title: Good except missing pieces.
customer_reviews.text: This kit is great except bottle 5 didn’t have a drip tip on it so when I went to test the alkaline in my pool the liquid came pouring out wasting half the bottle! One of my hands also looks like I am part smurf now.
customer_reviews.author: ExecAssistant

customer_reviews.title: Alkalinity is always wrong.
customer_reviews.text: The Alkalinity Is always wrong. It once read 240ppm and I went to get the water tested 10 mins later, it read 150. All the other test work fine. If my Ph is out of wack I just get the water tested at the pool store instead.
customer_reviews.author: javier

customer_reviews.title: Good for hot tub
customer_reviews.text: We use this to monitor our hot tub. Working great.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly A. Guenther

customer_reviews.title: In accurate Color palette
customer_reviews.text: This is the second time purchasing this test kit, as the first one was pretty accurate and worked well. The color palette for Chlorine for the new unit is way off, one can see in the picture. The top line (5.0) should be more like orange not yellow. I am glad I still had the one from the first kit.
customer_reviews.author: Yosep Kim

customer_reviews.title: Accurate - Easy -
customer_reviews.text: I had Leslie's Pools testing my water and their recommendations were off by a factor factor of three. Yes, they had my volume right but after four water tests I wasn't convinced they knew what they were doing. Now my pool's PH and Chlorine levels are where they nee to be
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I needed to keep my pool chemistry in balance. The case and the product are fantastic. I even liked how there were quick instructions, just in case I forgot how many drops each bottle needed.
customer_reviews.author: Jake Allissa

customer_reviews.title: I like these
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be very accurate, lower priced than Taylor. I always use two methods to cross check.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Hodge

product_meta.title: Poolmaster Essential Collection Chemistry Case (22260) 5-Way Swimming Pool & Spa Water Test Kit, Small, Neutral
product_meta.description:
Poolmaster's Essential Collection consists of the must-have products for customary pool and spa maintenance constructed with durable materials designed to keep your pool sparkling. For maintaining your pool or spa's water chemistry, Poolmaster's 5-Way Water Test Kit is a great choice. The Polyethylene case holds all necessary components neat and tidy. Easy-to-read indicator panel and round clear-view block make testing your water's chemistry a breeze. Includes solutions #1-#5. Test kit case color comes in either black or blue; contents are the same.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Since 1958, Poolmaster has been a leading manufacturer of aftermarket pool and spa products with an unwavering commitment to quality, service and reliability. Poolmaster offers products across six different product lines- Backyard and Decor, Inflatables, Floats, Maintenance, Swim and Dive, and Toys and Games. Poolmaster - We Make Water Fun!
feature_bullets: For maintaining proper water chemistry; tests for Chlorine, Bromine, pH, Acid Demand, and Total Alkalinity
Includes clear-view round test block with integrated color chips for accurate color matching
Includes 1oz. solutions of #1-#3 and 1/2 ounce solutions of #4 - #5; (Note: #2 Phenol Red is not the same as Phenol Red - DO NOT interchange)
#2 Phenol Red is for use with 5-Way Test Kits and Phenol Red is for use with 2 or 3-Way Test Kits
Note: The #1 solution is sealed to comply with transportation regulations. No other solutions in this kit require sealed caps
Test kit case color comes in either black or blue; contents are the same

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
